<@U6740K1SP>: Why does broadcasting over a 0-dimensional array produce a scalar? Thank you!
```julia> identity.(fill(1))
1```

elements.text: : Why does broadcasting over a 0-dimensional array produce a scalar? Thank you!

text:
I think because the broadcast machinery defines 0 dimensional arrays as scalars, which is also used to wrap arrays and treat them as scalars:
```julia> length(Ref(1))
1
julia> size(Ref(1))
()
julia> length(fill(1))
1
julia> size(fill(1))
() ```
